Package gov.nasa.larcfm.Util

Class NavPoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nasa.larcfm.Util.NavPoint
  • public class NavPoint
extends java.lang.Object
    An immutable class representing a position at a time. In addition a name (or label) can be attached to one of these NavPoints.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static NavPoint INVALID
      An invalid NavPoint.
      static NavPoint ZERO_LL
      A zero in Latitude/Longitude
      static NavPoint ZERO_XYZ
      A zero in Euclidean space

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      NavPoint​(Position p, double t)
      Construct a new NavPoint from a position and a time.
      NavPoint​(Position p, double t, java.lang.String name)
      Construction a non-TCP NavPoint piecemeal If a NavPoint is derived from an existing NavPoint, use one or more of the "make" factory functions instead.

      static Velocity finalVelocity​(NavPoint s1, NavPoint s2)
      Calculate and return the final velocity between two NavPoint This function is commutative: direction between points is always determined by the time ordering of the two points.
      int hashCode()  
      Velocity initialVelocity​(NavPoint s)
      Calculate and return the initial velocity between the current point and the given point This function is commutative: direction between points is always determined by the time ordering of the two points.

      Calculate and return the initial velocity between the two NavPoint.

      NavPoint linearDist2D​(double track, double time)  
      NavPoint linearEst​(Velocity vo, double tm)
      Compute a new lat/lon that is obtained by moving with velocity vo for tm secs This is a computationally fast estimate, and only should be used for relatively short distances.

    • Field Detail

      • ZERO_LL

        public static final NavPoint ZERO_LL
        A zero in Latitude/Longitude

      • ZERO_XYZ

        public static final NavPoint ZERO_XYZ
        A zero in Euclidean space

      • INVALID

        public static final NavPoint INVALID
        An invalid NavPoint. Note that this is not necessarily equal to other invalid NavPoints -- use the isInvalid() test instead.

      • NavPoint

        public NavPoint​(Position p,
                double t,
                java.lang.String name)
        Construction a non-TCP NavPoint piecemeal If a NavPoint is derived from an existing NavPoint, use one or more of the "make" factory functions instead.
        Parameters:
        p - position of new NavPoint
        t - time of new NavPoint
        name - string name (or label) of new NavPoint

      • NavPoint

        public NavPoint​(Position p,
                double t)
        Construct a new NavPoint from a position and a time. If a NavPoint is derived from an existing NavPoint, use one or more of the "make" factory functions instead.
        Parameters:
        p - position of new NavPoint
        t - time of new NavPoint

      • initialVelocity

        public static Velocity initialVelocity​(NavPoint s1,
                                       NavPoint s2)
        Calculate and return the initial velocity between the two NavPoint. This function is commutative: direction between points is always determined by the time ordering of the two points.
        Parameters:
        s1 - one NavPoint
        s2 - another NavPoint
        Returns:
        velocity between two points

      • initialVelocity

        public Velocity initialVelocity​(NavPoint s)
        Calculate and return the initial velocity between the current point and the given point This function is commutative: direction between points is always determined by the time ordering of the two points.
        Parameters:
        s - the given NavPoint
        Returns:
        velocity

      • finalVelocity

        public static Velocity finalVelocity​(NavPoint s1,
                                     NavPoint s2)
        Calculate and return the final velocity between two NavPoint This function is commutative: direction between points is always determined by the time ordering of the two points.
        Parameters:
        s1 - a NavPoint
        s2 - another NavPoint
        Returns:
        velocity

      • verticalSpeed

        public double verticalSpeed​(NavPoint s)
        Calculate and return the vertical speed between the current point and the given point This function is commutative: direction between points is always determined by the time ordering of the two points.
        Parameters:
        s - the given NavPoint
        Returns:
        vertical speed

      • averageVelocity

        public static Velocity averageVelocity​(NavPoint s1,
                                       NavPoint s2)
        Calculate and return the REPRESENTATIVE LINEAR velocity between two NavPoints. This function is commutative: direction between points is always determined by the time ordering of the two points.
        Parameters:
        s1 - a NavPoint
        s2 - another NavPoint
        Returns:
        velocity

      • linear

        public NavPoint linear​(Velocity v,
                       double time)
        Perform a linear projection of the current NavPoint with given velocity and time. If the current NavPoint is in LatLonAlt, then a constant track angle linear projection is used. Negative time is a projection in the opposite direction (along the same great circle, if in latlon) and into the past
        Parameters:
        v - velocity
        time - relative time
        Returns:
        a linear extrapolation NavPoint

      • linearEst

        public NavPoint linearEst​(Velocity vo,
                          double tm)
        Compute a new lat/lon that is obtained by moving with velocity vo for tm secs This is a computationally fast estimate, and only should be used for relatively short distances. Negative time is a projection in the opposite direction (along the same great circle, if in latlon) and into the past
        Parameters:
        vo - velocity away from original position
        tm - time of relocation
        Returns:
        new lat/lon position in direction v0

      • linearDist2D

        public NavPoint linearDist2D​(double track,
                             double time)

      • distanceH

        public double distanceH​(NavPoint np2)
        Horizontal distance between this point and the other given point
        Parameters:
        np2 - another point
        Returns:
        horizontal distance

      • distanceV

        public double distanceV​(NavPoint np2)
        Vertical distance between this point and the other given point
        Parameters:
        np2 - another point
        Returns:
        vertical distance
